Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Oral Antibiotics After Two-Stage Exchange Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive 3 months of oral antibiotics or no antibiotics after negative operative cultures at reimplantation.

Participants.evidence: adult patients undergoing two-stage hip or knee revision arthroplasty for PJI, meeting Musculoskeletal Infection Society (MSIS) criteria

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive 3 months of oral antibiotics or no antibiotics after negative operative cultures at reimplantation.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates whether a 3-month course of oral antibiotics post-reimplantation reduces infection recurrence.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was infection-free survival, assessed over a mean follow-up of 14 months for the antibiotic group and 10 months for the control group.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 107 patients were randomised: 59 to the antibiotic group and 48 to the control group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was performed on an intention-to-treat basis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Infection recurrence was lower in the antibiotic group (5% [three of 59] vs. 19% [nine of 48]; hazard ratio, 4.37; 95% CI, 1.297â€“19.748; p = 0.016).

Harms.evidence: Three patients experienced adverse reactions to antibiotics, leading to discontinuation, and four did not adhere to the regimen.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
